website_summaries.verdict: At a fraction of the price of competitors and with abilities that work for most consumers, this is an incredible value.
pros: Impressive power for a cordless model at an affordable price
Variable speed function provides excellent control
cons: Not the most rugged impact wrench, but it's still up to most tasks for the average user

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on removing 2 sets of lug nuts on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on removing 2 sets of lug nuts on my Honda Acord and Honda civic. The basic battery (not included) from porter cable lasted for the entire 2 jobs. It showed only 20% battery loss. Torqued down the lugs are 100 ft/lbs. This unit broke all the lugs free no problem after being sitting on the car 2 years and 12,000 miles. So much nicer than the loud air tools, plus no cord or hose to deal with! All my power tools are going battery!
customer_reviews.author: B. Renken

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, sweet and Impactful.
customer_reviews.text: This saved us multiple times out in the desert. It elevated the jacks on the toyhauler quickly and effortlessly. It also took off an castle nut on the axle with ease. Not to mention, it took the lug nuts off the Wildcat quickly. What a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: So far so good after 2 months of daily use *Update*
customer_reviews.text: Great impact, have had daily usage for over 2 months, no hiccups to speak of. Never really had any problems with lugs, maybe once or twice it took a little longer to zip off a lug but, it got the job done. Hopefully it will continue to perform, so far I'm happy. *Update* well it's now been over 6 months and this thing is still going strong, daily use, no problems to speak of. Batteries still going strong and working great!
customer_reviews.author: Free willy

customer_reviews.title: Be Realistic. It's great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have complained it's not as powerful as their air gun...well duh! It's a "portable" impact gun made for "convenience", and still has a significant amount of torque. I purchased it to remove the anod rods in the top of hot water heaters. It's virtually impossible to do that by yourself, on location, while the HWH is still hooked up. I used it on 3 tanks. Two came out easily, on one older one made it struggle for a second or two, but then out she came. I'm very happy with it and will be adding to my already extensive PC collection of battery powered tools. For the price, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

I thought I'd better spring for the correct tool for the job - it took the heavily rusted lug nuts off my utility trailer that hadn't been removed since it was new (more than 20 years) without fuss.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: What a great impact wrench for the money the only thing I would comment on is the difficulty in removing sockets from the wrench, and the overall weight of the tool ( about the same as a pneumatic 1/2 pro tool), other than that it’s fantastic. No comparison to 3/8 size tool as to power. It easily removes large bolts and wheel lugs and the battery easily handles all lawnmower bolts and large pulley bolts and nuts. Don’t try using the small battery pack, get the red one or the max pack.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: This is a work horse, loads of torque that doesn't decrease as battery charge runs low.
customer_reviews.text: I have no regrets going with this excellent tool, it has more torque than my Snap-on air powered Impact wrench and no air hose thats a pain to deal with. I run mine with the 4 amp Lithium-Ion batteries and cant believe how long I can go between charges, and get 100% torque that doesn't decrease as battery charge runs low. Batteries have excellent under load life and charged shelf life. Update: After 2 years in service this tool still works like new, its a solid powerful cordless tool made to take daily use. The resin plastic case has survived a number of falls off the car lift to the cement floor.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: WEAK WEAK WEAK
customer_reviews.text: I own and use the porter cable saw-saz and 3/8 impact for smaller jobs and love them. Therefore, I already own the charger and batteries. I decided to buy the 1/2 driver to operate my scissor jack and lug nuts. I was amazed that it was unable to raise the vehicle or pull the lug nuts. I tried 2 fully charged batteries. Totally shocked. Spend a little more and get the Dewalt or Milwaukee. It clearly did not provide me 300+ foot lbs of torque.

customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once to do a tire rotation on my 2015 Ram 1500 but it worked awesome. It removed and re-installed the lug nuts effortlessly. Great product, especially for a 20v system that works with the rest of my tools.

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE 20V MAX Impact Wrench, 1/2-Inch, Tool Only (PCC740B)
product_meta.description: The PORTER-CABLE PCC740B 1/2" cordless impact wrench, bare tool features a powerful motor which produces 330ft/lbs of torque for heavy applications. It offers a maximum of 1,650 rpm's for driving large fasteners quickly, with a full variable speed trigger for precision control. The 1/2" hog ring allows for quick and easy socket changes. It also has a pro grade lithium battery for long life and maximum performance, along with a led light which helps improve visibility in dark areas. This impact driver is designed with a chemical resistant housing for automotive friendly settings. It also offers the user over mold grips for comfort during use. This unit is lightweight and balanced at 6.0 lbs with battery, and it has a short length measuring 9.9" front to back. *This is a bare tool item - battery sold separately. Backed by porter-cable's 3 year limited warranty. Includes: (1) impact wrench.
